base.description: Override base image for this architecture

provisioners.description: Additional or replacement provisioners for this architecture

append_provisioners.description: Whether to append provisioners or replace them entirely

image.description: Image is the base container image reference (e.g., "ubuntu:22.04", "alpine:latest")

pull.description: Pull forces pulling the latest version of the base image (default: false)

auth.description: Auth provides authentication credentials for pulling from private registries

env.description: Env sets environment variables in the base image

privileged.description: Privileged runs the container with extended privileges (use with caution)

volumes.description: Volumes mounts host directories into the container (format: "host:container")

run_command.description: RunCommand overrides the default container run command

changes.description: Changes applies Dockerfile-style instructions (ENV, USER, WORKDIR, ENTRYPOINT, CMD)

BaseImage.description: BaseImage specifies the base image to start from

version.description: Version number for this changelog entry (e.g., "1.0.0")

date.description: Date of the release in ISO 8601 format (e.g., "2025-01-15")

changes.description: Changes is a list of changes made in this version

password.description: Password or access token for registry authentication (use environment variables for security)

ImageAuth.description: ImageAuth contains authentication information for pulling images

version.description: Version of the template (semantic versioning recommended, e.g., "1.0.0")

description.description: Description provides a brief summary of what this template builds

author.description: Author is the creator or maintainer of this template (name and/or email)

tags.description: Tags are keywords for categorizing and searching templates

requires.description: Requires specifies version requirements for warpgate and other dependencies

changelog.description: Changelog documents version history and changes (optional)

extra.description: Extra allows storing arbitrary key-value metadata (optional)

output.description: Output specifies the path where the manifest file should be written

strip_path.description: StripPath removes directory paths from artifact names in the manifest

repository.description: Repository is the target repository name (e.g., "ghcr.io/org/name")

tags.description: Tags is a list of tags to apply to the image (e.g., ["latest", "v1.0.0"])

force.description: Force overwrites existing tags if they already exist

login_server.description: LoginServer is the registry login server for ECR/ACR authentication

login_username.description: LoginUsername is the username for registry authentication

login_password.description: LoginPassword is the password or token for registry authentication (use environment variables)

format.description: Format specifies the compression format: "tar.gz", "zip", "tar.bz2", etc.

compression_level.description: CompressionLevel sets the compression level from 1 (fast) to 9 (best compression)

checksum_types.description: ChecksumTypes specifies hash algorithms to use: "md5", "sha1", "sha256", "sha512"

only.description: Only restricts execution to specific build sources

except.description: Except skips execution for specific build sources

keep_input_artifact.description: KeepInputArtifact preserves the original artifact after post-processing

PostProcessor.description: PostProcessor represents a post-processing step after the build

only.description: Only restricts execution to specific build sources (e.g., ["docker.amd64", "docker.arm64"])

except.description: Except skips execution for specific build sources

inline.description: Inline contains shell commands to execute line by line

environment.description: Environment variables to set during shell command execution

playbook_path.description: PlaybookPath is the path to the Ansible playbook file

galaxy_file.description: GalaxyFile is the path to requirements.yml for installing Ansible Galaxy roles

extra_vars.description: ExtraVars provides additional variables to pass to Ansible

inventory.description: Inventory is an inline inventory string for Ansible

inventory_file.description: InventoryFile is the path to an Ansible inventory file

ansible_env_vars.description: AnsibleEnvVars sets environment variables for Ansible execution (format: "KEY=value")

use_proxy.description: UseProxy enables using a proxy for Ansible connections

collections_path.description: CollectionsPath specifies the path to Ansible collections

scripts.description: Scripts is a list of script file paths to execute

ps_scripts.description: PSScripts is a list of PowerShell script file paths to execute

working_dir.description: WorkingDir sets the working directory for provisioner execution

user.description: User specifies which user to run the provisioner as

warpgate.description: Warpgate specifies the minimum warpgate version required (e.g., ">=1.0.0")

type.description: Type of build target: "container" for Docker images or "ami" for AWS AMIs

platforms.description: Platforms specifies target platforms for multi-arch builds (e.g., ["linux/amd64", "linux/arm64"])

registry.description: Registry is the container registry to push to (e.g., "ghcr.io", "docker.io")

tags.description: Tags is a list of image tags to apply (e.g., ["latest", "v1.0.0"])

push.description: Push automatically pushes the image to the registry after building

region.description: Region is the AWS region where the AMI will be created (e.g., "us-east-1")

instance_type.description: InstanceType specifies the EC2 instance type for building (e.g., "t3.medium")

ami_name.description: AMIName is the name to assign to the created AMI

ami_tags.description: AMITags are key-value tags to apply to the AMI

subnet_id.description: SubnetID is the VPC subnet ID to use for the build instance

volume_size.description: VolumeSize is the root volume size in GB for the AMI

provisioners.description: Provisioners to run during the build

post_processors.description: Post-processors to run after the build

arch_overrides.description:
Architecture-specific overrides (optional)
Allows specifying different configurations per architecture
